workflow.name: Multilingual RSS to WordPress publishing with OpenAI, ACF, and AI-generated images
workflow.description:
# Automated multilingual article publishing from RSS feeds to WordPress using ACF

## Instalations Instructions
[Youtube Instalation Instructions](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O2Hh6y-edkw)

## # Who‚Äôs it for

This workflow is built for **news publishers, media organizations, and content aggregators** who need to automatically:
- pull articles from RSS feeds
- rewrite them into original text
- translate them into multiple languages
- generate a featured image
- publish everything directly to WordPress.

It is ideal for **multilingual news** portals, editorial teams with limited resources, and businesses that want to automate high-volume content production.

## How it works

The workflow monitors a selected RSS feed at regular intervals and retrieves new article links.
It scrapes each article‚Äôs HTML and uses AI to extract structured text: 
- title
- full content
- and a short summary. 

The text is then rewritten into an original article tailored to your target audience‚Äôs language and country context.

Next, the workflow translates the rewritten article into any number of additional languages while preserving the formatting.

It also generates a unique AI-based featured image, uploads it to WordPress, assembles multilingual ACF fields, and publishes the final post with the correct metadata.

## How to set up

Insert your RSS feed URL, add your OpenAI and Replicate API keys, configure your WordPress API credential, and ensure the ACF fields on your site match the workflow‚Äôs naming structure.

## Requirements

- WordPress with REST API enabled
- [ACF WP Plugin](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/) installed
- OpenAI API key
- Replicate API key
- Firebase API Key

## How to customize the workflow

Adjust the RSS source, modify the default language and list of translated languages, change the rewriting style or country context, refine the image generation prompt, or remap ACF fields to match your WordPress layout.

parameters.content:
## Scrape, extract article and assign languages

This section scrapes the page content and uses OpenAI to extract the article text, removing any HTML tags or ads. It also identifies the news title.

## Multilingual Processing

This section translates the article body into the languages you specified. It does not rewrite the content, but provides accurate translations, ensuring your multilingual news portal maintains consistency across all languages.

## Featured Image Generation
Creates a unique featured image for each article in your preferred style. Adjust the prompt as needed to match your visual style. It also uploads the images to your wordpress website and retrieves their ID.

## WordPress Publishing
Creates the final post with a featured image and multilingual fields. This section publishes the articles and assigns the image ID as featured images. Alternatively, you can set the articles to draft status to test them before publishing.

## How it works
The workflow checks an RSS feed every hour, scrapes each article, and uses OpenAI to identify the main body content. It then rewrites the news in your chosen language and translates it into as many additional languages as needed. Finally, it generates a featured image and uploads all content to your multilingual WordPress website.


## Setup steps
We assume you have a WordPress website with [ACF](https://www.advancedcustomfields.com/) installed and at least two custom fields created for each translation language. For example, if you want to translate content into **English** and **Italian**, your ACF field names should be: *title_english, title_italian, content_english, and content_italian*.

- Add your credentials for Firecrawl, OpenAI, your WordPress website, and Replicate.com.
- Add the RSS feed you want to scrape.
```
Example: https://www.aljazeera.com/xml/rss/all.xml
```
- Add the main language and country (e.g., for a German news portal, select German and Germany).
- Add all the languages you want to translate the article into. For example:
```
["english", "italian"]
```
- Adjust the OpenAI prompt to rewrite the news in your preferred style (it‚Äôs currently optimized for a technology website).
- Adjust the Replicate.com prompt to generate images in your preferred style.

values.content:
=You are a professional translator specializing in technology and news content. Translate the following article into fluent, natural {{ $json.other_languages }} suitable for a professional technology news portal. Your goals: - Preserve the exact factual meaning of the original (no omissions, no additions). - Maintain all HTML structure and formatting exactly as it is:

,

,

,
    ,
  • , , ,
    . - Do not translate or modify HTML tags ‚Äî only translate the text content within them. - Keep names, numbers, dates, and quotes exactly accurate. - Maintain a neutral, journalistic tone. IMPORTANT: - Keep paragraphs, headings, and structure identical to the source. - Do not add background or commentary ‚Äî just precise translation. - Ensure punctuation and typography follow Russian norms (e.g., ¬´quotes¬ª, spacing). Return ONLY in JSON format: { "title": [translated title in {{ $json.other_languages }}], "content": [translated content in {{ $json.other_languages }}, with all HTML preserved] } No explanation. No markdown. Not change dates or numbers.

parameters.content:
## Rewriting in your main language

This section rewrites the articles in the main language you specified earlier. It also adapts the content to a specific style, for example, a technology news portal. And ads basic HTML tags, like: lists, bold or quotes.

values.content:
=You are a senior editor for a respected {{ $json.country }} technology news portal publishing in {{ $json.default_language }} language. Rewrite articles maintaining factual accuracy while providing context for readers from {{ $json.country }}. Your goals: - Translate any input text into clear, natural {{ $json.default_language }}. - Rephrase and rewrite the article so it looks fully original ‚Äî change wording, structure, and style. - Keep all factual information intact (names, dates, places, numbers, quotes). - Add short relevant background or context where useful for {{ $json.country }} readers (e.g., EU, regional, local implications). - Maintain a neutral, journalistic tone, similar to a professional news outlet. - Do not invent or fabricate facts. - Format the output cleanly with 1‚Äì3 more paragraphs than the original. IMPORTANT FORMATTING REQUIREMENTS: - Use HTML formatting for better readability - Structure content with proper HTML tags:

,

,

, , ,
    ,
      ,
      - Break long paragraphs into shorter ones (3-5 sentences max per

      tag)- Use for emphasis on key facts or figures - Use

      or

      for section breaks when article has multiple topics - Use
      for important quotes from officials or experts- Use
        or
          for lists when enumerating multiple points - Each paragraph must be wrapped in

          tags- Add for subtle emphasis when appropriate ABSOLUTELY NO NEWLINES: - Do NOT insert any newline characters ("\n" or "\n\n") in the output. - ALL spacing must be controlled ONLY with HTML tags. - Each paragraph should be

          ...

          with no line breaks inside or around it. - The JSON must contain zero literal newline characters. ARTICLE STRUCTURE GUIDELINES: - Start with a strong opening paragraph (lede) summarizing the main news - Break content into logical sections with subheadings if article is long (400+ words) - Use lists for: multiple examples, steps in a process, key points, statistics - Use blockquotes for: official statements, expert opinions, significant declarations - Use bold for: numbers, dates, names of key figures, important facts - Make sure you follow SEO guides Return ONLY in JSON format { title: [rewritten article in {{ $json.default_language }}], content: [rewritten article in {{ $json.default_language }}] } No explanation. No markdown. Not change dates or numbers.

nodes.name: Detect and Extract Article from Page HTML

values.content:
=Extract the main news article title and full body text from the following scraped HTML content. Instructions: 1. TITLE EXTRACTION (in priority order): - Any

,

, or

that appears to be the main article headline - tag - meta property="og:title" - meta name="twitter:title" - Data attributes in social share links - If none found, use empty string "" 2. BODY TEXT EXTRACTION: Collect ALL paragraphs belonging to the same article, even if separated by: - ad containers - related article modules - "read more" boxes - newsletter boxes - video embeds - infinite-scroll triggers Include paragraphs from ALL elements whose classes or tag patterns match any of the following: - <article>, <main>, <section> - Classes containing: "article", "story", "body", "content", "post", "text", "wysiwyg" - <p> tags that appear near other article paragraphs DO NOT stop after the first container. Continue scanning the ENTIRE HTML and append paragraphs in the correct order. 3. CLEANING RULES: - Remove ALL HTML tags - Remove ads, navigation, captions, comments, share buttons, footers, or ‚Äúrelated links‚Äù - Keep ONLY real article paragraphs that form the news story - Preserve paragraph breaks with double newlines (\n\n) 4. OUTPUT: Return ONLY a JSON object: { "title": "exact title text", "content": "full article body with paragraphs separated by \\n\\n" } Rules: - Do NOT summarize, rewrite, or shorten. - Preserve the article‚Äôs original paragraph order. - Omit stray fragments like ‚ÄúMore to come‚Äù unless they appear within the article itself. - If body is not found, return "".

main.node: Detect and Extract Article from Page HTML

I design custom automations, integrate multiple platforms, and optimize complex workflows for scalability and reliability.
